Accrete is looking for a Director of Engineering, responsible for leading the Data and Platform group. Accrete’s Data and Platform Engineering team architects, builds, manages, and is otherwise responsible for all of Accrete’s data storage, data workflows and pipelines, artificial intelligence, and machine learning implementations, infrastructure as a service offering, continuous integration, and continuous deployment processes. Reporting to the Head of Engineering, the Director of Data and Platform Engineering will work closely with senior leaders of Accrete’s Knowledge, Product Management, Finance, and Information Security departments, as well as with technical leads and architects from across Engineering.Responsibilities: Lead a team of highly-talented Platform Engineers, supporting Accrete cloud operations, continuous integration and deployment, development operations, and infrastructure-as-a-service
Lead a team of highly-talented Data Engineers, supporting Accrete data workflows, including batch processing, streaming analytics, data warehousing, graph analytics, artificial intelligence deployment
Develop and execute a strategic direction for the Platform Engineering and Data Engineering teams as relates to the Accrete company strategy
Champion Platform Engineering and Data Engineering interests at the executive level
Dive into code on an as-needed basis to support the team with hands-on delivery Requirements8+ years experience in engineering, product/technical program management, data engineering5+ years of hands-on experience in big data, using technologies such as Hadoop, Spark, Kafka or equivalent5+ years people management experience, including 3+ years of experience managing multiple teamsExpertise with data-oriented programming languages such as Python, Scala, Clojure, Julia or similar Experience with continuous integration and deployment best practicesKnowledge of contemporary best practices for infrastructure-as-code for cloud-native deployments using Docker, k8s, and related technologiesExcellent communication skills to relate to employees at all levels of the organizationEnthusiasm, energy, and optimism about the future of artificial intelligence and the desire to build incredible AI productsThe base salary range for this position is: $220,000 - $240,000 USDBenefitsWe offer a competitive salary, benefits package, and opportunities for growth and advancement within the company. If you are an innovative and results-driven leader, we encourage you to apply for this exciting opportunity.Accrete is a Prime Defense Contractor delivering configurable dual-use AI solutions that automate complex analytical work to both government and commercial customers with a focus on defense, intelligence, and cybersecurity.To learn more about Accrete, please visit our website: Accrete.aiAccrete is an equal opportunity/affirmative action employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to sex, gender identity, sexual orientation, race, color, religion, national origin, disability, protected Veteran status, age, or any other characteristic protected by law.
